title: MORTICIA'S MIDNIGHT DINER
description: Gothic horror camp meets sultry sophistication. Where Vampira serves coffee and Elvira takes your order, all while Vincent Price provides the dinner theater. A place where darkness is beautiful and monsters have the best taste in music.

appetizers.title: TWILIGHT APPETIZERS
appetizers.description: Easing Into Darkness - Gateway tracks to the gothic experience

vampire_kiss.title: Vampire's Kiss
vampire_kiss.description: Seductive entry-level gothic with that 'come closer' allure. Perfect for luring the innocent into darker musical territories. These tracks have just enough danger to be thrilling, just enough romance to be irresistible. Music for those who find beauty in shadows.
vampire_kiss.samples: "Love Song for a Vampire" by Annie Lennox, "Somebody That I Used to Know" by Gotye, "I Put a Spell on You" by Bette Midler, "Disturbia" by Rihanna

moonbeam.title: Moonbeam Martini
moonbeam.description: Ethereal and mysterious with silver-screen glamour. Think Morticia Addams dancing alone in the moonlight. These tracks capture that haunting beauty of midnight elegance, where grace meets gothic and sophistication has a supernatural edge.
moonbeam.samples: "Venus in Furs" by The Velvet Underground, "Sway" by Michael Bubl√©, "Strange Love" by Depeche Mode, "Wicked Games" by Chris Isaak

gothic_martini.title: Gothic Martini
gothic_martini.description: Sophisticated darkness with a twist of lime and doom. Edgar Allan Poe meets James Bond in the most elegant way possible. These tracks understand that the best cocktails are served with a side of existential dread.
gothic_martini.samples: "Gloomy Sunday" by Billie Holiday, "Mack the Knife" by Bobby Darin, "Paint It Black" by The Rolling Stones, "House of the Rising Sun" by The Animals

main_courses.title: MAIN COURSES FROM THE CRYPT
main_courses.description: The Dark Essentials - Pure vintage horror hostess energy

vampira.title: The Vampira Special
vampira.description: Pure vintage horror hostess energy. Sultry, theatrical, and dangerously charming with that perfect bouffant attitude. These tracks embody the glamorous gothic icon who made horror sophisticated and seduction spooky. Music for late-night creature features and dramatic poses.
vampira.samples: "Fever" by Peggy Lee, "I Put a Spell on You" by Screamin' Jay Hawkins, "Cry to Me" by Solomon Burke, "Seven Devils" by Florence + The Machine

bride.title: Bride of Frankenstein's Lament
bride.description: Tragic beauty with electrical energy. Big hair, bigger emotions, and the spark of something unnatural. These songs understand that sometimes love requires a little lightning, and the most beautiful monsters are the ones who never asked to be created.
bride.samples: "Love is Strange" by Mickey & Sylvia, "Howl" by Junun, "Strange Love" by Depeche Mode, "Bad Things" by Jace Everett

price.title: The Vincent Price
price.description: Sophisticated horror with theatrical flair. Classy, camp, and deliciously over-the-top. These tracks channel the master of horror's wit and style - elegant terror with a wink and a perfectly timed dramatic pause. Music for those who appreciate their scares served with style.
price.samples: "Time Warp" from Rocky Horror, "This is Halloween" by Marilyn Manson, "Welcome to My Nightmare" by Alice Cooper, "Somebody's Watching Me" by Rockwell

addams_family.title: ADDAMS FAMILY COMFORT FOOD
addams_family.description: Campy & Kitschy - Dark but loveable, weird but warm

fester.title: Uncle Fester's Electric Blues
fester.description: Quirky family dysfunction set to music. Dark but loveable, weird but warm. These tracks celebrate the beautiful freaks and loving outcasts who make normal families seem boring. Music that understands that strange is just another word for special.
fester.samples: "The Addams Family Theme," "People Are Strange" by The Doors, "Creep" by Radiohead, "Mr. Brightside" by The Killers

wednesday.title: Wednesday's Diary
wednesday.description: Deadpan gothic with teenage angst. Dark humor meets coming-of-age rebellion. These songs capture that perfect storm of adolescent darkness and dry wit that makes growing up gothic an art form. Music for those who wear black and read Poe.
wednesday.samples: "How Soon Is Now?" by The Smiths, "Hurt" by Nine Inch Nails, "Mad World" by Gary Jules, "Paint It Black" by The Rolling Stones

cousin_itt.title: Cousin Itt's Hair Metal
cousin_itt.description: Unintelligible but undeniably groovy. Sometimes the best communication happens without words, just pure vibes and fabulous hair. These tracks celebrate the beauty of being misunderstood.
cousin_itt.samples: "Louie Louie" by The Kingsmen, "Wild Thing" by The Troggs, "96 Tears" by ? and the Mysterians, "Woolly Bully" by Sam the Sham

rocky_horror.title: ROCKY HORROR LATE NIGHT
rocky_horror.description: Sexual & Theatrical - Gender-bending liberation at midnight

transvestite.title: Sweet Transvestite
transvestite.description: Gender-bending, sexually charged theatrical rock. Corsets, fishnets, and absolute liberation. These tracks celebrate sexual freedom and theatrical excess with unapologetic joy. Music for those who know that the best parties happen after midnight and involve costume changes.
transvestite.samples: "Sweet Transvestite" from Rocky Horror, "I'm Not Wearing Underwear Today" by Avenue Q, "Rebel Rebel" by David Bowie, "Bad Romance" by Lady Gaga

laboratory.title: Laboratory Love
laboratory.description: Mad scientist romance with electric passion. The beauty in the beast, the method in the madness. These songs understand that the best love stories involve a little experimentation and that passion sometimes requires protective eyewear.
laboratory.samples: "Touch-a Touch-a Touch Me" from Rocky Horror, "Weird Science" by Oingo Boingo, "She Blinded Me with Science" by Thomas Dolby, "Laboratory" by Dua Lipa

midnight_movie.title: Midnight Movie Madness
midnight_movie.description: Cult classic energy with audience participation required. When movies become rituals and rituals become religion. These tracks understand that the best entertainment happens after normal people go to bed.
midnight_movie.samples: "Science Fiction/Double Feature" from Rocky Horror, "Dammit Janet" from Rocky Horror, "There's a Light" from Rocky Horror, "Wild and Untamed Thing" from Rocky Horror
